alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 1:24PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County through 215 PM MST... At 124 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Joseph City, or 27 miles southeast of Winslow, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holbrook and Joseph City. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 289. Interstate 40 between mile markers 271 and 294. State Route 377 between mile markers 27 and 33. State Route 77 between mile markers 384 and 396. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 310. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
